abstract: Amid a weak merger market, drug makers are striking a flurry of deals, with Pfizer agreeing to sell its infant nutrition unit to Nestlé for $11.9 billion on Monday.
snippet: Amid a weak merger market, drug makers are striking a flurry of deals, with Pfizer agreeing to sell its infant nutrition unit to Nestlé for $11.9 billion on Monday.
lead_paragraph: If mergers activity rises this year, as ever-optimistic deal makers say will happen, health care transactions will help lead the way.

headline.main: A Hot Time for Health Care Deals

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Adding to a flurry of health care deals announced on Monday, Thomson Reuters has sold its health care unit to an affiliate of Veritas Capital for $1.25 billion in cash.
snippet: Adding to a flurry of health care deals announced on Monday, Thomson Reuters has sold its health care unit to an affiliate of Veritas Capital for $1.25 billion in cash.
lead_paragraph: On a rather active Merger Monday highlighted by two health care acquisitions – Nestlé’s $11.9 billion purchase of the infant nutrition unit of Pfizer and AstraZeneca’s $1.26 billion buyout of Ardea Biosciences – Thomson Reuters is adding one more deal to the mix.

headline.main: Thomson Reuters Sells Health Care Business for $1.25 Billion

abstract: By agreeing to acquire Pfizer’s infant nutrition business for $11.9 billion, the Swiss food giant Nestlé is paying a high premium to gain access to the baby food markets in emerging countries.
snippet: By agreeing to acquire Pfizer’s infant nutrition business for $11.9 billion, the Swiss food giant Nestlé is paying a high premium to gain access to the baby food markets in emerging countries.
lead_paragraph: Nestlé is throwing down its cash.

headline.main: Nestle Pays a High Price for Pfizer Unit
